column4: it "might" be possible to use the same home directory and setup files, so your data and settings are the same, but your programs need speicific versions for each hardware
I know that, but cntb was trying to tell me that generic would do that
it is possible to make an "live" ubuntu hd isnt it? sumtin that work on all x86.

yeah all x86, I think you were asking about x86 plus ppc and x86_64, even if you only ran it on x86 machines, if the hardware was different settings for certain packages could be drasically different and casue problems
